sentences: Mis sa istud nagu tukunui, tee ka midagi!
Poiss on nagu tukunui, ei saa s√µnagi suust.
context: The Estonian word 'liigutage' is the plural imperative form of the verb 'liigutama', which means 'to move'. It's an instruction telling a group of people to move themselves quickly. In the context of the first example sentence, it appears with 'tukunuiad' (dopey/drowsy people) suggesting these people are being told to get moving despite their sluggish or dazed state.
